column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

Despite large falls of rain in the area Blackall combined agents yarded 5,600 head for the monthly special weaner and store sale. Overall quality was good and increased competition from local restockers saw averages improve 10-40c across the board. 

Light weight restocker steers saw a lift of 40c selling to 432.2c to average 385c and steers 280 to 330kg improved by 10c topping at 408.2c to average 376c/kg. Restockers paid up to 396.2c for steers 330 to 400kg to average 349c, while medium feeders averaged 329c/kg. Heavy feeder steers made to 346.2c to average 324c, up 24c, with restockers paying to an isolated 360.2c/kg.

Light weight restocker heifers improved selling to 320.2c to average 258c/kg. Quality heifers 280 to 330kg to join sold to 320.2 with most around 259c/kg.
Medium weight heifers to feed sold to 285c to average 257c while feeders heifers over 400kg also made to 285c to average 260c/kg.

Heavy heifers to the processor sold to 290.2c to average 269c and heavy cows improved by 30c selling to 252.2c to average 245c/kg.
